articles.author: Simon Robinson
articles.description: Inflation dropped in most economies around the world in 2024, but voters didn’t care.
articles.title: Inflation, elections and war dominated 2024

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea's main opposition party threatened on Monday to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo if he failed to proclaim a law to launch a special counsel investigation into President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed bid to impose martial law.
articles.title: South Korean opposition threatens to impeach Han over martial law counsel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's security service has named a Russian general it suspects of ordering a missile strike on a hotel in eastern Ukraine in August and said he acted "with the motive of deliberately killing employees of" Reuters.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russian general deliberately targeted Reuters staff in August missile strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's cabinet warned on Monday the island's security might be at risk after opposition parties passed laws that will require cuts in government spending, including defence, at a time when China has ramped up military activity nearby.
articles.title: Taiwan warns defence could suffer under opposition's funding laws

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus said on Monday he had approved a United States extradition request for former U.S. Marines pilot Daniel Duggan, who faces charges including breaking U.S. arms control law by training Chinese military pilots to land on aircraft carriers.
articles.title: Former US Marines pilot who worked in China to be extradited to US, says Australia government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's new government will not be announced before Monday evening to take into account a day of mourning for cyclone-hit Mayotte, the presidency said in a statement, prolonging the political uncertainty in a major European power.
articles.title: No French government before Monday evening, presidency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A driver who ploughed his car into students and pedestrians in Changde, a city in southern China, has been handed the death sentence with a two-year reprieve, Chinese state television CCTV reported on Monday.
articles.title: Driver in China school car crash incident handed suspended death sentence

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Trump's Truth Social post was an exceedingly rare example of a U.S. leader saying he could push a sovereign country to hand over territory.
articles.title: Trump says he might demand Panama hand over canal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six people were killed and others injured in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced people in Gaza, the civil emergency service reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Six killed in Israeli strike on school sheltering displaced people in Gaza, civil emergency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of people gathered in central Belgrade on Sunday to protest against President Aleksandar Vucic and his ruling Serbian Progressive Party (SNS), whom they blame for a railway station roof collapse last month that killed 15 people.
articles.title: Tens of thousands gather in anti-government protest in Belgrade
